newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - July 23.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - July 23.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.

- China's economy maintains appropriate growth in the first half of the year, with GDP rising up by 9.5 percent. Major economic indicators such as inflation rate, foreign exchange reserves and investment rate all point to positive prospects.
- State grain purchase sees big increase in second quarter thanks to central government policy to buy in surplus grain from farmers beyond the purchase quotas at protective price.

- Chinese acupuncture has spread to more than 120 countries and regions and World Federation of Acupuncture-Moxibustion Societies and World Health Organisation will sponsor conference in Beijing in November.
- B share markets in Shanghai and Shenzhen attract growing number of foreign investors confident in China's economy.

- Finance Ministry vows to strengthen administration of state funds and cut fiscal deficits. Minister Liu Zhongli says local governments have no right to give tax breaks and exemptions and enterprises should pay overdue taxes
- Agricultural Bank of China sells 15.5 billion yuan bonds in first half
- President of China National Petrochemical Corp calls for cracking down on diesel smuggling, says government has taken measures to curb problem
- Investment in real estate development drops 2.9 percent in first five months
- The Ministry of Public Health calls for more efforts to combat epidemics with priority on prevention as drought in north and floods in south threaten to breed epidemics.
- Poor infrastructure facilities, especially transport, are slowing pace of economic development in western China. Railway authorities will construct seven new lines to tap resources.
- China will host 15th World Petroleum Congress in Beijing from October 12 to 16. Chinese President Jiang Zemin to give opening address.
